pullRequest.body:
## Modules

* `TensorProduct.finsuppLeft`, the tensor product of `Î¹ â†’â‚€ M` and `N` is linearly equivalent to `Î¹ â†’â‚€ M âŠ—[R] N`

* `TensorProduct.finsuppScalarLeft`, the tensor product of `Î¹ â†’â‚€ R` and `N` is linearly equivalent to `Î¹ â†’â‚€ N`

* `TensorProduct.finsuppRight`, the tensor product of `M` and `Î¹ â†’â‚€ N` is linearly equivalent to `Î¹ â†’â‚€ M âŠ—[R] N`

* `TensorProduct.finsuppLeft'`, if `M` is an `S`-module, then the tensor product of `Î¹ â†’â‚€ M` and `N` is `S`-linearly equivalent to `Î¹ â†’â‚€ M âŠ—[R] N`


This is the first part of PR #10824 which contains three applications of these functions to monoid algebras, polynomials and multivariate polynomials.

It has been split because this part is reasonably sound, while the three other files are more like propositions.

---

nodes.body: Thank you very much! It looks good for me.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1c3e18e3-6a49-49c5-a844-4a8384e01649) for commit b400dac8f756ca9b992ef57fbf3d6e5dbb2cb54e.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/100c3591-641d-42bd-8f27-6301eb04e92c/to/1c3e18e3-6a49-49c5-a844-4a8384e01649) against commit f4fd1b19f0e2ab3989c2fef5511ab2341f8b2607:
```diff
  Benchmark                                  Metric         Change
  ================================================================
- ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.DirectSum.Finsupp   instructions   244.6%
```
@alreadydone, is there something else that you would want me to add or change?
Thanks for the shorter versions, I'll use them, and I'm OK to make the arguments of finsuppLeft explicit, in accordance with what is done for docs#TensorProduct.directSumLeft
Can you please fix the compile errors (which probably results from the implicitness changes)? Thanks!
I had not noticed that there were errors left, sorry. I make the necessary adjustments at once.

Thanks ðŸŽ‰ 
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8605961008/job/23583351950)

I've done the golfs [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/ACL/FinsuppTensorProd_part1...jyxu/FinsuppTensorProd?expand=1). I made the defs `finsuppLeft` etc. shorter but it may make it harder for the reader, so feel free to adopt the changes that you think is appropriate. I gave two proofs for `finsuppLeft_apply_tmul` etc. and you're free to adopt either.

It's a bit weird that `finsuppLeft` etc. have no explicit argument, but LGTM.
Largely LGTM but I might come back to golf some proofs ...
Sorry for the delay, I'll get back to this tomorrow.

I've done the golfs [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/ACL/FinsuppTensorProd_part1...jyxu/FinsuppTensorProd?expand=1). I made the defs `finsuppLeft` etc. shorter but it may make it harder for the reader, so feel free to adopt the changes that you think is appropriate. I gave two proofs for `finsuppLeft_apply_tmul` etc. and you're free to adopt either.

It's a bit weird that `finsuppLeft` etc. have no explicit argument, but LGTM.
I'd remove unnecessary parentheses (you did not add parentheses in the previous lemma for example).
OK
I'd replace `.trans` by `â‰ªâ‰«â‚—`. Do you prefer `trans`?
yes, it's much faster to type to meâ€¦
Anyway, I changed trans to that. It spares some parenthesesâ€¦
